text:
Hello,
we integrated for one of our client a synchronization between HubSpot and Sylisus (e-commerce platforme) in order to use the HubSpot CRM. In order to associate Products to Deals via API we do the following actions:
- Creation of deal via “Create deal” API
- We push in the deal: product_id, name & price (wich is suppose to have currency format)
Nevertheless, there is no way impose a currency. The value will always use the default option of the HubSpot instance, making multi-currency conversion impossible.
Do you know if it’s possible to assign currency in the price object ?
Thank you in advance,
hey <@UFEMNG3RA> are you using ecomm bridge api ?
and are you sending currency code in this `deal_currency_code` ?

Hi <@UCH1L597V>
No i don’t use this. I just call Deal and Product API
ecomm bridge API ? There is a documentation for this ? I can use this bridge for solve my problem ?

With Product API
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/products/create-product>
There are no access to currency
well you can set the currency using that field too, but for ecommerce i would recommend this -<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/ecomm-bridge/ecomm-bridge-overview>
you can manage the currency in deal

Hey Guys, any helpful suggestions or things to take care, for merging two existing HubSpot portals into one large Instance via API data transfer?  Almost all assets would have to be migrated eg. contacts, lists, mails, landing pages, workflows

Hi,

I was using a Create Contact, Create Company and Create Deal API and it was working fine yesterday but its not working as expected since today morning.
So, is there any suggestion for this sudden change in API behaviour.
Is there any up-gradation in HubSpot?

When the workflow sends the ticket data to a webhook, which field connects the ticket with the contact? I thought is was hs_created_by_user_id, but that gives in my case, a developer sandbox, a number that is not a contact id.

Hey <@UQ5KJLR7X> Can you share the account id that you were working on?  There isn’t anything overall that would have caused this to stop.  Can you also share what responses you are getting from the API?
I guess I have to use the get associations endpoint to get the contact.
Hi everyone, I was wondering if anyone had created a process for copying over an entire production portal to a sandbox?
you might have some luck using the CLI <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development>
The problem with that is, I want to get pages/forms/etc from production into my sandbox for working on existing content

Is it possible to send an api request for results from 2 blogs within the same website?  - we have our Blog and a custom blog called Resources...we'd like to create a page that shows both results combined.  `<https://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v2/blog-posts?hapikey=API_KEY&content_group_id=1123456,1654321>`
